Initially, I believed the worst, but after some research into how the music 
business works, I believe Pebbles is credible! Pebbles brought these girls 
in (TLC) on a beginners contract which is generally negotiable upon the 
success of first album sales. Beginner's contracts generally repay monies 
to investors [Pebbles & (possibly) L.A. Reid], offer low royalties off 
album sales, and monies to producers, attorneys, etc. Pebbles initially put 
up well over $100,000.00 of her and possible L.A. Reid's money to establish 
TLC to get their first album made. This explains what Pebbles mentioned 
about having to live within your  means on a new beginners contract and 
getting RAV 4s instead of Ferraris. Note -- Pebbles is the fourth [lower] 
rung on the hierarchy ladder; [L.A. Reid], her husband and his company is 
the third rung; Arista Records under Clive Davis is the second rung, and 
BMG Music is the top rung. Upon the success of TLC's first album, Pebbles 
was going to renegotiate TLC's contract for their future recordings, but 
TLC was pulled from Pebbles by Arista (Clive Davis). Their contracts were 
then under Arista. I'm unsure whether Pebbles still produced them, but she 
was not in control of their finances or contractual agreements. My belief 
is that BMG (top rung) and Arista (second rung) made  most of the money, 
and that TLC was responsible for all group expenses through their 
contracts. I remember that the "Don't Go Chasing Waterfalls" video cost 
about $3,000,000.00 to be made. Who paid for this? One final note ... 
Pebbles was an established singer from the mid-80s well into 90s and made 
beautiful music with her incredible voice. Many years ago, it was stated 
that as a very young woman in a recording studio, she carried herself with 
such a mature flair - meaning no entourages, no senseless spending of money 
she didn't yet have, and a high degree of professionalism with the people 
she worked with. TLC made great music! I believe through that they have 
been lead to believe incorrect information by those who probably sensed 
Pebbles would take the fall to not shuffle any feathers. I don't believe 
that Pebbles was perfect with everything but I believe her to be credible. 
I don't believe she ripped them off, but I do believe the higher ups on the 
chain were responsible and that TLC were unaware of the expenses their 
careers entailed under their contracts (after Pebbles)! ﻿
